{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3145095,"name":"Jackson Hochstetler","username":"hochstetjac33","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hochstetjac33/{size}/184799_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-14T04:11:51.582Z","cooked":"

So our team has a mechanism that, if unrestricted, could cause damage to other parts of the robot. We would like to have limit switches at both ends of its motion to act as electrical stops if anything goes wrong in the software. We plan on having soft stops in the code, as well as tracking the position with a REV Through Bore Encoder. Would there be any way to do this with a Spark MAX? We know that we need an adapter to plug the encoder into the data port, but which one should we use, and how would we incorporate limit switches on the same motor controller?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-02-14T04:11:51.582Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":179,"reads":174,"readers_count":173,"score":929.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":426754,"topic_slug":"using-an-encoder-and-a-limit-switch-on-a-sparkmax","display_username":"Jackson Hochstetler","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50189,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3767"},"post_url":"/t/using-an-encoder-and-a-limit-switch-on-a-sparkmax/426754/1","custom_user_title":"3767","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3145151,"name":"Tauseef Afraz","username":"TFM110","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tfm110/{size}/197758_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-14T08:33:08.637Z","cooked":"

Since you plan on using the REV Through Bore Encoder, you could also take advantage of receiving absolute data with the REV Absolute Encoder Adapter, which also has solder pads for limit switches which you can utilize. This adapter plugss straight into the Spark MAX’s data port

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-02-14T08:34:05.396Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":163,"readers_count":162,"score":62.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":426754,"topic_slug":"using-an-encoder-and-a-limit-switch-on-a-sparkmax","display_username":"Tauseef Afraz","primary_group_name":"Swyft-Robotics","flair_name":"FUN","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/3/5/3523e759b0af37a7757142a8b2aa79b31f1a47c4.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":60,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.revrobotics.com/rev-11-3326/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Absolute Encoder Adapter - REV Robotics","clicks":44}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":39084,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC5431AM | FRC5790M| FUN | SWYFT"},"post_url":"/t/using-an-encoder-and-a-limit-switch-on-a-sparkmax/426754/2","custom_user_title":"FRC5431AM | FRC5790M| FUN | SWYFT","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3145154,"name":"Robert Woodhead","username":"MadOverlord","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/madoverlord/{size}/163860_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-14T09:00:59.182Z","cooked":"

One thing to be aware of about the Rev adapters is that soldering wires onto those pads is quite the challenge. They really should be through-holes, not pads. I personally would drill small through-holes into the pads to help with the mechanical connection.

Last year when we needed to put a limit switch on our climb arm, we ended up getting the correct ribbon-cable connector and soldering the correct wires to our limit switch wires. If you only need to connect your hardware limit switches to the Spark Max (ie: the encoder is being connected to the Rio) I would recommend this approach.

This is the cable you need, just chop one in half and solder to the correct wires: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07FW14TCF/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1

MadOverlord:

They really should be through-holes, not pads.

I agree. We didn’t have too much trouble soldering, but a week later the pad pulled off the board and disconnected the switch.
